page.title: 16River Ribble in Ribchester
page.content: The Ribble is used for fishing,canoei- ng and swimming.The river has changed course; it meanders about quite a lot. Since it has changed course it has covered up part of the Roman fort. In 1980 there was a big flood, the river burst its banks covering fields and most of the village. The water rose to within six feet of the school wall. It flooded some people's houses. The sand martins nest along the river bank. There is only one crossing in our block and that is the De Tabley bridge; once people had to go to Clitheroe to cross. When people come and swim they bring dingies and go down the rapids. Quite a lot of Roman remains have been found in or near the river: a helmet, which is now in the British museum, and the pillars of the White Bull Inn. A lot of fishermen come and fish here.
